皷字的基本解释

皷
gǔ
古同“鼓”。

皷字的汉语字典释义

[①]［gǔ］
［《廣韻》公户切，上姥，見。］
亦作“皷1”。亦作“鼔1”。
(1)打击乐器。多为圆桶形或扁圆形，中间空，一面或两面蒙着皮革。
(2)泛指器乐。古代鼓用以节制其他乐器，古人以为群音之长，故称。
(3)鼓声。
(4)鼓面。
(5)钟磬被敲击之处。
(6)击鼓。
(7)指击鼓使进。
(8)敲击或弹奏（乐器）。
(9)振动；摇动。
(10)泛指敲或拍。
(11)挥动；舞动。
(12)用风箱等扇（风）。
(13)（风吹）使膨胀。
(14)凸起；涨大。
(15)激发；振作。
(16)煽动；蛊惑。
(17)鼓吹，抬高。
(18)击鼓的乐师。
(19)形状、作用、声音像鼓的。
(20)罩在髻外的发饰。
(21)古代计时单位。因击鼓报时，故称。
(22)古代量器或衡器名。其容量大小或重量轻重说法不一。
(23)计量。
(24)古称布十匹为一鼓。
(25)古国名。春秋时鼓国，在今河北省晋县以西，为白狄的一支。
(26)通“

皷字的康熙字典解释

【午集中】【皮字部】　皷； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页791第36
【正字通】俗鼓字。

Basic explanation of words
drum
gǔ
Gu Tong "drum".
drum
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [gǔ]
["Guangyun" public account cut, grandma, see you. ]
Also known as "Drum 1". Also known as "鼔1".
(1) Percussion instruments. They are mostly barrel-shaped or oblate, with a hollow in the middle, and one or both sides are covered with leather.
(2) Refers to instrumental music in general. Ancient drums were used to control other musical instruments. The ancients thought that the group sound was long, so it was called.
(3) Drums.
(4) Drum head.
(5) The place where Zhong Qing was struck.
(6) Drumming.
(7) Refers to drumming to make progress.
(8) Percussion or play (musical instrument).
(9) Vibration; shaking.
(10) Generally refers to knocking or pat.
(11) Waving; dancing.
(12) Use a wind box and other fans (wind).
(13) (The wind blows) to inflate.
(14) Protruding; swelling.
(15) Excite; cheer up.
(16) Incitement; incitement.
(17) Advocate, lift up.
(18) Musician who plays drums.
(19) The shape, function, and sound are like drums.
(20) Hair accessories covered in a bun.
(21) Ancient time unit. It is called because of drumming to tell the time.
(22) Names of ancient measuring instruments or weighing instruments. There are different opinions about its capacity or weight.
(23) Metering.
(24) In ancient times, ten pieces of cloth were called a drum.
(25) Ancient country names. In the Spring and Autumn Period, the Drum Country was a branch of Bai Di in the west of Jinxian County, Hebei Province.
(26) Through "
